topSong.title: The Sign
topSong.released: January 1994 ( United Kingdom , February 21, 1994 ( United States )
topSong.label: Arista

descr.p: "The Sign" is a 1993 dance-pop song by the Swedish band Ace of Base. The song was an international smash hit, spending six non-consecutive weeks as number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in the United States, also reaching Number two in the United Kingdom. It was on an album called Happy Nationin most of the world, but The Signin North America.

The song was the #1 song of 1994 according to Billboard magazine's year-end charts. The song was ranked at #51 on The Billboard Hot 100 All-Time Top Songsfor the first 50 years of the Hot 100 chart. The song has been covered by The Mountain Goats.
The music video of the song features the pop group singing amidst romantic and frolic images; "The Sign" was depicted as an ankh and a djed. The music video is Directed By: Mathias Julin.

Amid the images is a little story of a man and woman sitting side by side until the man leaves, seemingly abandoning the woman. However, he comes back with a rose and offers it to the woman. The woman graciously accepts and takes his hand. However, a bright light shines in the woman's face, drawing her away, abandoning the man and dropping the rose on the chair.
